runs.comm: starts with one down the leg side which is turned to square leg - who misfields. Poor start by Ireland - they really must be on top of their game
got him! Rankin strikes! A good, straight bouncer which Dilshan tried to pull but top edged it to O'Brien's left, who jogged a few metres to swallow an easier skier. Massive wicket!
good first ball just outside off, punched out  to the off side
horrid ball - do not bowl there. Short, wide and it sat up and audibly begged to be hit. Jayasuriya cuts it with tremendous power square of the wicket for the day's first four
much better, cutting back on the left-hander who's back and defending on the tips of his toes
very good line and length, defended out to the off side
poor start - a leg-side wide
on the off stump, Sangakkara comes tentatively forward, shuffling into a defensive
very good delivery, on off stump with just a hint of shape back into the left-hander. It's defended again to mid-off
uppercut - but he's placed it nicely, and it drops short of third man
blocked off the back foot
on leg stump, coming onto the left-hander on the angle, and he chops down on it defensively
not a convincing stroke. A fuller delivery on leg-stump which he works off his pads, but only at the last moment
lucky, very lucky! Short ball on leg, he pulls it but mistimes it and it only just beats short fine-leg
defended on the back foot. Better line this time, just outside off
good length, cuts back into him and jags nastily into his midriff. In fact, he got an inside edge into his midriff, and very nearly into his family jewels
clipped with greater authority to backward square leg
a waste down the leg side
again not in control, but pushes it out to the off side
flicked down to fine-leg
squeezed out to the off side, but another good line from Johnston
a huge shout by Johnston as he pitches this on middle, Sangakkara playing across the line and the ball squirts out to the off side. That was deadly close!
got him now! A brilliant catch by O'Brien standing up to the stumps, Sangakkara beaten by extra bounce and getting a thin edge to the keeper. And he walks!
outside off - wide enough
wide of the off stump, and fortunate not to be wided - prodigious swing away from the right-hander
cuts and swings away from the right-hander arm-shouldering. Good, testy delivery and a fine over
bang. Uppishly driven with huge amounts of bottom hand, but he placed it in the gap. Three foot either side and he might be back in the pavilion
crunched out to the off side
a single is stolen to the leg side, as he works it off his pads. Encouraging bounce but tennis-ball bounce really; it's not the quickest of pitches
nicely played by Jayawardene, nudging it to mid-on and immediately calling a single. Good intent by mid-on, though, attempting a shy at the stumps
brilliant. Skips down the pitch and outside leg, before slashing and slapping square of the wicket.
good comeback by Rankin, on off stump and it's defended
poor ball but he's spared major punishment by the short fine-leg

lofted over midwicket for four. Not quite timed - in fact they only pick up three. Make that four after all! Johnston is apoplectic at the fielding and throw. I shan't say his words, but they were of a four-letter variety; a raging F bomb by the big man
swing and a miss to an outswinger. Good, full length and he plays and misses
follows it with a fine outswinger! That's a beautiful delivery
and another - that's a fantastic delivery. Wide of the crease, angling into off stump and it holds its line, beating Jayawardene's rather imbalanced drive, attempting to loft it over long-on
just about leaves it alone, but only at the last moment. That's such a fine over from Johnston
defended on middle
good, flat delivery on the off stump, nudged to leg
outside off, turning back sharply and it's blocked out to the off side
squeezed out to the off side - to backward point in fact. Great stop by Johnston
smashed out to deep extra cover
flicked to leg where Porterfield, the captain, makes a good and urgent diving stop
short and pulled through midwicket. Rankin gives chase from square leg but, oh dear. Oh dear. Fielding fail from the big man - he lets through a horror!
oh what a stroke - the most classical cover-drive you could wish to see
slower ball and Jayawardene is forced into a change of shot - fine bowling. Jabbed back just short of the bowler

good line but just short enough to be dabbed behind square. But hang on - this'll be tight! Porterfield gets in quick but his throw misses the stumps. That would've been curtains for Jayasuriya! He was miles short
a loopy, slow full toss and the left-hander nearly stepped across to reveal (and lose) his leg-stump! But it's tickled for four to the vacant fine leg
flogged to leg
too straight by West and swept past short fine-leg, who parries it to a wider fine-leg
crashed over cover for four. Fine shot
driven across the turf out to the off side
tossed up on his legs, he gives himself room and comfortably works it out to deep extra cover
well wide of the off stump. Poor bowling, really, for such a leg-side field. Hammered square of the wicket
leg-side this time, but he's paced his little nudge and placed it well too, for two
outside off, dabbed to short fine leg. Great hands
outside off, dabbed to short fine leg. Great hands
full on his legs, swept backward of square
again pulled to leg
reverse sweep - or was it a switch? Just a reverse, I think, and he had all the time in the world to get himself into position, so slow are these offies
tucked to leg for just a single
beats Jayawardene outside off as he tries to cut this square
pushed into the covers and excellent fielding from Porterfield prevents any runs...good stuff from Ireland
first six of the day, Jayawardene comes across his crease and sweeps the ball high over deep square-leg...not brute force in that shot, just timing
fired wide of the off stump as the batsmen gives himself a touch of room, O'Brien whips off the bails but Jayawardene is safe
driven out to the cover sweeper
ooh, run out chance for Ireland as Jayasuriya pushes into the off side and Jayawardene sets off before being sent back, but the throw misses at the non-striker's end
round the wicket, Jayawardene goes way to the off side and then misses his sweep..half an appeal, but not out
full toss this time and easily helped over short fine-leg, that's easy pickings for a batsman of Jayawardene's class
carved away off a thick outer half of the bat through backward point, and excellent running from Jayasuriya (who is nearly 40) makes it into three

gone! There's the breakthrough for Ireland, Jayasuriya goes for the sweep and is taken on the inside of the front pad...big appeal from McCallan and Tony Hill raises his finger. Jayasuriya isn't happy and that breaks an important stand
driven down the ground to get off the mark
worked to long on to end a successful over for McCallan
drops a little short and wide first ball, cut away between short third man and backward point to bring up Jayawardene's fifty off 33 balls...a classy innings, and an important one for Sri Lanka
that's wonderful batting, opens the face and guides this fine past short third man...all in the wrists from Jayawardene as he picks the gap
plays and misses as he goes to drive through the covers
pushed down to long off
cut away to backward point, O'Brien lucky to get away with that
better line, on off stump and pushed back to the bowler
goes for an extravagant reverse sweep but gets into a tangle and the ball bobbles off the pad to short fine-leg
conventional sweep from Silva, well placed out to deep square-leg
middles this sweep as well, goes straight to the man on the boundary
very full, slog-swept out to deep midwicket and goes one bounce to Cusack who is patrolling the boundary
another goes, this time the sweep proves the downfall as a top edge goes straight down Rankin's throat at deep square-leg. Silva couldn't have picked out the fielder any better
good finish to the over, on off stump and pushed back down the pitch
over the wicket, offers some width but Jayawardene cuts straight to point
fired down the leg side, wrong line from West
that's better, a yorker that Jayawardene digs out into the off side
picks out backward point with another cut, just missing the placement in that shot
tucked off the toes to short fine-leg, non-striker makes a quick call and hustles through
swept from outside off in front of square out to deep midwicket
driven down to long off, a decent comeback from West
worked through square leg, a slightly wild throw from West but it doesn't cost anything
stifled appeal from McCallan as Mubarak gets an inside edge onto his pad and they manage to scamper a quick single into the off side
cut away through the off side
bunted down the ground to long-on
well placed through the leg side, picks the gap between midwicket and deep square-leg
moves across outside off and sweeps this over short fine-leg...he's played that a few times with excellent timing and placement
full outside off, squeezed into the off side
gives himself and drives through the off side, real sense of urgency as Jayawardene sprints back for a second
driven elegantly up to long off
uses his feet and drives out to deep cover
top shot, backs away outside leg stump which allows him to drive inside-out over extra cover...he beats the cover sweeper, that was Jayawardene at his best
well placed sweep this time as West loses his line on leg stump, paddled round the corner and beats short fine-leg...this is a top innings
fired across outside off, excellent take from Niall O'Brien and the umpire lets Cusack get away with it
low full toss outside off, driven wide of deep cover which means there is time to come back for a second
another wicket at a good time for Ireland, Mubarak went for a pull and gets a big top edge that loops high on the off side, Niall O'Brien calls for it and takes the catch easily
good yorker on leg stump, all Jayawardene can do is squeeze it out into the off side
low full toss and Mathews can only drive it to cover who is on the edge of the circle
gone! Cusack strikes again and this is the big one. Jayawardene gives himself room to go through the off side, but he misses and Cusack hits.
a leading edge from Mathews as he tries to work into the leg side but it flies safely through the gap at cover
down the leg side, not the line from Rankin, means an extra ball for Sri Lanka
driven hard into the pitch and bounces high enough to elude even the huge reach of Rankin, but it's just a single down the ground
low full toss, aiming for the yorker, slammed back at the bowler who deflects it into the off side
and another! Kulasekara drives in the air to long off where John Mooney runs in to take a fine low catch
hoicked away through the leg side, through cow corner and beats long on for a valuable boundary
full on leg stump, thick inside towards short fine-leg to end the over
thick outside edge flies over backward point towards third man, there's time to come back for a second...but it's boundaries Sri Lanka need
gone! The golden spell from Cusack continues as he castles Mathews, who tried to sweep this fine but missed...Cusack has just stuck to bowling straight and it has worked
excellent delivery, 77mph, full on middle and Malinga can only push it back to Cusack and there's no chance of a single
swung through the leg side but without any timing, deep midwicket keeps it to a single...top stuff from Ireland
and another! Murali can only last one ball, has a big swing at a full toss, misses, and Niall O'Brien brings off another superb stumping. His glovework has been outstanding in this tournament

dropped so nearly a fifth wicket for Cusack as Mendis drives in the air towards long off, but Kevin O'Brien can't quite get down to the catch and can't stop the boundary either...he gave his all for the catch
